FuncDef: The reset delayed-release ip-address command reclaims a specified IP address that is in the delayed release state, or the IP addresses that are in the delayed release state in a specified address segment of an IP address pool.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start IP address that is in the delayed release state.
The value is in the dotted decimal format.

Specifies the end IP address that is in the delayed release state. If you do not specify this parameter, only one IP address is reclaimed.
The value is in the dotted decimal format.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the access ip-address delayed-release time command is run to configure a delay for IP address release, most IP addresses may be in the delayed release state. As a result, users cannot go online within a period of time. To resolve this issue or reclaim the IP addresses that are in the delayed release state as required, run the reset delayed-release ip-address command.
This command can be run only in the view of a local, RUI-slave, dynamic, or server address pool.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
